Haha. :P

It's not that I have trouble animating... I mean I am not an animator by any means. I don't even know the first thing about it. But it's that I have trouble with Flash not doing what it is supposed to do.

For example why doesn't the Paint Bucket tool fill in what it is supposed to when I can SEE the lines connecting, leaving no gap... but on other parts where there is a gap in the lines it fills it in.
Gaaarg![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

Or when you make a...
Actually... my brother hates Flash for the same reasons I do. And he can say what the problem is better than I can. [url=http://www.notablogtm.com/topics/flash.htm]Go read what he has to say here.[/url]

I nearly pop a blood vessel when I try to use it. I can only hope that since Adobe bought out Macromedia that they will finally put in a decent UI and make the program intuitive.

title: Um... ooookay
content:
I've never noticed the kinds of problems with Flash you're talking about... either that, or I know why it does certain things, and know how to fix them.

For instance, Paint-bucket tool has different modes... if you have it on "Don't Close Gaps", it won't fill unless there are absolutely no gaps in the actual line (line thickness is not considered in this). Easiest way to figure that out is to press the little colored square in the layer you're drawing on to see what the program understands the lines as.

I still like it.
